title: Anivia's Q indicator size is WRONG!
body:
Included is a picture showing what i mean, the circle indicator around Anivia's Q is not accurate to the actual radius, in the picture i purposefully detonated the skillshot just before the actual ice ball hits but after the minions have entered the stun radius, and the minions are not affected, in the picture there are clearly 4 minions within the circle, but when detonated only 1 minion was stunned/damaged, I'm not sure if this is a bug or just a mistake in the indicator size but whats the point in an indicator that is that misleading, it actually hinders the player rather than helps them. i don't mind if the stun radius is enlarged to fit the indicator or if the indicator is shrunk to fit the stun radius but the two should match up.
can a Riot person please confirm whats going on with this?

replies.body: Yes. I have noticed this a lot and it needs to be brought to attention. Why hasn't this been addressed before? How the hell do Anivia mains put up with this? The indicator leads me to believe that it stuns everything in the circle, however I think that the circle you see in the screenshot may just be the first part of the ability (damaging things it passes through) but the explosion radius is separate and has no indicator. {{champion:34}} {{item:3070}}

This happens almost 75% of the time, Since I've started playing her I've noticed it heaps and it is really annoying its cost deaths and not getting kills. 
Riot pleaseâ€¦.!
